alert.note: Alert for Estill; Jackson; Laurel; Lee; Owsley; Pulaski; Rockcastle (Kentucky) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued January 12 at 9:50AM EST by NWS Jackson
info.description: ...Strong thunderstorms will impact portions of central Laurel, northwestern Owsley, southern Estill, northern Pulaski, Jackson, Rockcastle and Lee Counties through 1015 AM EST... At 950 AM EST, Doppler radar was tracking strong thunderstorms along a line extending from near Rockford to near Hogue. Movement was east at 45 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 40 mph and pea size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Strong thunderstorms will be near... Morrill around 955 AM EST. Hisel, Locust Branch, Shirley, Kerby Knob, Clover Bottom and Sandgap around 1000 AM EST. Alcorn, Bobtown, Blanton Flats, Jinks, Brazil, Woodstock, Station Camp, Waneta, Bandy and Collingsworth around 1005 AM EST. Valley Oak, Shopville, Drip Rock, Alumbaugh, Foxtown, Wagersville, Macedonia and Level Green around 1010 AM EST. Other locations in the path of these storms include Old Orchard, Arvel, Wind Cave, Bloss, Leighton, Lakes, Banford, Evelyn, Yellow Rock and Bent. THIS INCLUDES THE FOLLOWING HIGHWAYS... Interstate 75 in east central Kentucky between mile markers 43 and 72. Kentucky Highway 80 in Laurel County between mile markers 1 and 7. Kentucky Highway 80 in Pulaski County between mile markers 22 and 40. Louis B. Nunn Parkway MAX HAIL SIZE...0.25 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. A Severe Thunderstorm Watch remains in effect until 400 PM EST for south central, southeastern and east central Kentucky.

area.areaDesc: Estill; Jackson; Laurel; Lee; Owsley; Pulaski; Rockcastle
